snippet: The suddenness of the Valley Fire’s surge in Northern California last weekend forced thousands of evacuating residents to leave their animals, both pets and livestock, behind.
abstract: California fire officials say Valley Fire, only one-third contained after burning 67,200 acres and 585 homes, has killed one person and injured four others; volunteers are rescuing and healing hundreds of horses and pets left behind during evacuation.

byline.contributor: Ashley Southall contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The suddenness of the Valley Fire’s surge in Northern California last weekend forced thousands of evacuating residents to leave their animals, both pets and livestock, behind.

headline.main: Frantic Evacuation in California Left Animals to Face Wildfire Alone
headline.print_headline: Frantic Evacuation in California Left Animals to Face Wildfire Alone
